articles.author: Crispian Balmer, Parisa Hafezi, Jana Choukeir
articles.description: An Israeli military official said 50 Israeli jets had struck around 20 targets in Tehran overnight.
articles.title: Thousands of Iranians flee Tehran bombing; Trump said to consider joining Israel in strikes

articles.author: Steve Holland, Jeff Mason
articles.description: The prospect of a U.S. strike against Iran has exposed divisions in the coalition of supporters that brought President Donald Trump to power, with some of his base urging him not to get the country involved in a new Middle East war.
articles.title: Trump faces uproar from MAGA base over possible Iran strike

articles.author: Yurii Kovalenko, Dan Peleschuk
articles.description: Flags across Kyiv were lowered to half-mast on Wednesday, as Ukrainians mourned more than two dozen people killed a day earlier in Russia's deadliest strike on the capital this year.
articles.title: Kyiv mourns as death toll from Russian strike climbs to 28

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russian President Vladimir Putin on Thursday cautioned Germany that Moscow would consider it to be directly involved in the war in Ukraine if Berlin supplied Kyiv with Taurus cruise missiles, but said he was ready to speak to Chancellor Friedrich Merz.
articles.title: Putin cautions Germany over any Taurus missile supplies to Ukraine

articles.author: Andreas Rinke, Alexander Ratz
articles.description: The aim of the talks which the German source said are taking place in coordination with the US, is to persuade Iran to guarantee it will use its nuclear program solely for civilian purposes.
articles.title: Exclusive: European ministers to hold nuclear talks with Iran on Friday in Geneva, source says

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Israeli gunfire and strikes killed at least 30 people across the Gaza Strip on Wednesday, local health authorities said, as some Palestinians there said their plight was being forgotten as attention shifted to the air war between Israel and Iran.
articles.title: Israeli fire kills 30 in Gaza, medics say, as attention shifts to Iran

articles.author: Simon Robinson
articles.description: Russian President Vladimir Putin said on Thursday that Iranian society was consolidating around the Islamic Republic's leadership when asked by Reuters if he agreed with Israeli statements about possible regime change in Tehran.
articles.title: Regime change in Tehran? Putin says Iran is consolidating around its leaders

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The governments of Rwanda and the Democratic Republic of Congo on Tuesday initialed the text of a peace agreement between the two countries, the U.S. State Department said in a joint statement.
articles.title: Rwanda, DRC initial peace agreement ahead of next week's signing

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The law is an attempt to ease a demographic crisis caused by Russia's war and to enhance ties with Ukraine's diaspora.
articles.title: Parliament passes law to allow multiple citizenship for Ukrainians

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Iran would accept U.S. President Donald Trump's offer to meet soon, the New York Times reported on Wednesday, citing a senior Iranian official.
articles.title: Iran would accept Trump's offer to meet soon, New York Times reports
